author: Pavel Salin
comment: Last update screw all good in the app, now necessary functions on different screens, swipe from one screen to another. But worst thing switching off from app - like on old Windows XP - Are you sure that you want to switch off TV?, you will lost connection. Every time you should confirm the same, yes, yes, yes I'm sure.... Developers-designers added more clicks, swipes, they don't like straight easy ways, hate app now!

author: Mike D
comment: Super annoyed. The upgrade doesn't seem to have simple features like direct sharing of a web link from phone to LG browser. The "Share Via" option seems to have disappeared. The new app may be more visually appealing but the user experience is far worse. The app has become very cumbersome.

author: Peter van Lonkhuyzen
comment: Love the app on my phone. I do have a slight problem with it on my watch. Although we are now close to a point of your watch becoming a magic remote. The app doesn't look at the device screen size and cuts off the bottom causing the home and back buttons to become lost. Device is a polar m600 watch.

author: Everth Espinoza
comment: New update removed feature to share out off Chrome on Android. If you don't have the content downloaded directly on your phone you can no longer stream to TV. Was a 4 star app before. Extremely dissatisfied.

author: Éva Zámbori
comment: Since the latest update I am not able to share Mixcloud or SoundCloud streams to tv any more, and since this was 95% of what I used the smartphone app for, I am most unsatisfied now.  I really don't see why would someone use a smartphone to simply switch between live TV channels - for that, the remote control is already well designed.

author: Sadra Momeni
comment: some features are removed.  _ app icon removed from share menus for share from any app to tv.  _ can't access to all programs of antenna, cable and satellite same time. it was very useful for fast switching between programs from different live tv sources. now there isn't any access to other live tv sources (antenna, cable, satellite). or any method for change live tv source.  _ marked programs as favorite, not divide from other programs. it's not useful now.

author: THEDXB Sam
comment: This new update is dump and extremely unfriendly user experience. For God sake how they designed it?!?! Another LG fail.  First of all: the app starts in Live TV mood (how many are using live tv?)  Second: App lunch is far to reach I.e. if you want to start Netflix: you have to swipe every single time to TV menu then TV app list then pick the app)  Third: touchpad is placed opposite to thumb and it's hard to swipe between control, live tv and tv menu)

author: Daniel Dayao
comment: S' okay. UI arrangement came complicated tho. Could you add a feature to hear the audio through the phone? Some of your TVs don't have bluetooth, so it's inconvenient to use wired headsets. Maybe we could hear the audio through the phone instead??

author: brian ryberg
comment: Why have you made it so cumbersome to get back to livetv after a chromecast session. You have to slide to timen, tv-inputs, livetv, ok. Old version only needed: slide to programmes, select channel. Bam! Easy. Not now.                Update: Only a complete power remove from TV made it possible to regain remote control?  Previous rant:  LG uh615v  is useless in conjunction with this new version. Connect connect connect. You can see the TV, but this app fails to trigger what needs to be triggered for TV to show the code you need. You invented this, can you fix your own errors? Yes, I am on same 5g wifi wlan. Your app see my devices changed name, but only after 'app clear data' on mobile.   Fail.

author: Kiet Ma
comment: Not user friendly. When I selected the content share feature, all I see on the TV is my phone's name. Great, means it's connected. But how the heck do I share my contents? No instructions what so ever. All I can do is move the mouse on the TV from LG TV Plus app.  What's that got to do with content sharing?

author: Richard Kilby
comment: The ergonomics and layout of this app is clunky. Still cant simply favourite some channels and see whats on from the just favourite channels. Does this app have a development direction or is every update just a menu rearrangement. Current direction is horrible.

Too many windows to sort through, just want items in one small non-scrolling page like an original remote. Lack of previous model support forces install of multiple apps for each LG TV and BR player I own which is disappointing. LG should try focusing on one all encompassing app rather than half assed apps and leaving barely functioning and error prone ones like I'm stuck with for expensive 3-4 year old purchases.
The upgrade basically put it out of business.  It worked beautifully before. Now, it can't even find my smart TV.   Wish I could go back and uninstall the update. I'd still be using it.

author: Bruce Crossan
comment: New version cannot find my TV anymore. Why do you kill support for older WebOS 2.0 4K TVs?   It kills the battery, though. More than screen and all other processes combined.

author: Dave Mulligan
comment: The UI update is great, but one feature now missing is viewing channels from both Antenna and Satellite at the same time. I'd be happy if it was possible to quickly switch between the two, but alas it is not. It would also be very nice if the app could change / manage the order of the channels as this is very difficult via the normal TV interface.

author: Sujay Aranha
comment: By Golly they finally fixed the bugs in this app. It is much smoother to operate than before. Good to have when you cannot find the remote, or just want forget about it all together.

author: Mike Davidson
comment: Would be nice if the app remembered the tv you were using it on. Kind of defeats the purpose of I have to power the tv on with the remote. Come on LG GET YOUR THINGS TOGETHER

author: J Wohl
comment: Worthless. Does not connect to my 55UJ62 LG TV. Tv and phone are connected to same wifi. App searches for Tv and never finds it. COMPLETELY WORTHLESS!!!

author: Farshid Shafiabady
comment: Totally disappointed by the latest update. Childish design and can't directly share web links to the app anymore. Can't believe LG came up with this trash update

author: Van Culpepper
comment: Not sure why it's a 3.8. I give it 5 stars because it's everything the physical remote is and more. Our Boxer ate the original remote and I have used this app for the past couple days with no issues. I prefer using this app on my phone because I can see what I'm selecting with lights off. It does everything.

author: Naresh Kumar V S
comment: Updated app UI looks good but still i am not able to change channel/ switch between channel by typing numbers and arrow. Only i can able to update volume and launch different apps.

author: E. L
comment: Good job, the app works. But it's waaay more cumbersome to use over the actual remote.

author: Hakan Ka
comment: The new design is horrible compared to the old one. It had all I needed in one place, but this one just separated everything and feels weird. Inconvenient to use. Need to revert to the original asap.

author: Christy Coberly
comment: Of the several remote apps that I tried, this was the only one that worked. Super easy to set up. Took no time and very straight forward.

author: t cathcart
comment: Terrible update, from the ergonomics to the short cuts and especially losing the BT audio switch. It's practically useless now where the previous version worked perfectly.

author: Ian McGuirk
comment: Noooooo......Where is the programme list gone??? I was able to simply jump between stations and have my favourites. Gone now. Very disappointed!

Semi useful app for when you can't find the remote. The main feature I used it for was the share to in chrome so I can open web pages from phone on TV. The 4.0 update removed this functionality, so the app is pretty lacking value to me anymore. Please add the share feature back.
New update absolutely rubbish, won't play my videos . App keeps crashing. Bring back the old version!! That was perfect

author: Rodrigo Ramirez
comment: I would like you to add a keypad whenever you want to search a movie or something, is to slow to type with the tv remote. Furthermore, i think it would be very useful a little remote on the notification center, so you don't have to stop doing something to change the channel.

author: David Casey
comment: Gone from a excellent  app to usless app over night, where is the full programmes  list between antenna and satellite gone. It was so great to be able to switch from antenna programmes to satellite programmes.

author: Soly
comment: Please put the share ability from web browser on smartphone back.  Whoever designed this revamp should be fired.  This update sucks!!!

author: STARTJIM
comment: Keep it connect even wen the device is locked whats the point of pushing connect now to reconnect if i lock my device for a 1 min its just useless may as wel keep using the remote. Also this app has crashed my tv more then 3 times now have to pull the plug out so it goes off and i can use it again...

author: Constantine Johnny
comment: Latest update is really awesome. It doesn't deserve the low rating. For LG smart tv, this app is for me the best out there.

author: Mitchell Schreiber
comment: App is improving from my first review about a year ago. Battery issues are gone as well as connectivity issues to TV.

author: Mahmoud Ali Kassem
comment: Turn on tv by mobile function is not working, tv isn't paired when it turned off, -1*.  Updates keep coming and no fix for any problem, -1*.  No response from Support, -2*.

author: Victor Cuellar
comment: It was perfect then it got updated and now the LGTV Plus icon won't appear when trying to share content to TV via the share button on things. Only option is to open the app, navigate to select media to share and send to TV (takes longer and it's so many more taps to get to) please bring back the option to share content via the share menu on S8+ devices.

author: Sanket Kumar Singh
comment: It doesn't matter how much talented you are, if your time is wrong, you'll end up making wrong decision - like the one I did when I choose to go with LG Smart TV against brands like Sony, Samsung and Panasonic with far better refresh rate and picture quality. Because when it comes to smartness, believe me it's a hoax. My Smart TV is not even capable of remembering wifi password. The moment I switch it on, it requires me to re-authenticate by entering all the passwords again. Plus I bought my TV in Feb 2018 from authorized showroom and they sell me 2017 model with assurance that I'll receive upcoming update, but now LG declares that it'll be updating only 2018 models with WebOS 4.0. Now one can imagine how much cheated I'm feeling right now. I spent around 50000 bucks on my new TV. All I want to suggest is to go with a dumb TV and make it smart via Chromecast or Picast and yes, don't go with LG Products.

author: Paul C.
comment: The programme list from my tv is unsorted. No option to sort at all. Very annoying and it used to work with the older version

author: p palmer
comment: The older version  is better in everything..The new one sucks i can't share anything on TV then  it's arrangements are down to earth

author: HeyitsRJ
comment: The app is useful and good except the magic remote pointer is VERY slow and unresponsive. Please look into this matter and solve it at the earliest. Thank you.
